He stopped and remained silent for a long time. 
Pierre could not and did not wish to break this silence. 
"He exists, but to understand Him is hard," the Mason began again, looking not at Pierre but straight before him, and turning the leaves of his book with his old hands which from ex- citement he could not keep still. "If it were a man whose existence thou didst doubt I could bri
